isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1991) - ENGINE DIAGNOSTIC TEST PROCEDURES FOR 7.3 LITER DIESEL ENGINES - TEST INJECTION NOZZLES - Removal

svcproc.title: Removal
svcproc.para: Before removing nozzle assemblies, clean exterior of each nozzle assembly and the surrounding area with clean fuel oil or solvent to prevent entry of dirt into engine when nozzle assemblies are removed. Also, clean fuel inlet and fuel leak-off piping connections. Blow dry with filtered compressed air.

note.para: Remove and cap the line pressure sensor on the #4 cylinder nozzle to allow fuel return tee removal.

step1.para: Disconnect the high pressure fuel injection line connector nuts at each nozzle.
Remove the fuel return (leak-off) lines as an assembly, as follows:

step2.para: Remove the pump to fuel return tube hose at the fuel return elbow at pump. Cap elbow at pump. Disconnect hose from leak-off tee to fuel filter at the leak-off tee.
Loosen the two fuel return tubes and retaining clamps (one at the intake manifold and one at the engine lifting eye).
With clamps removed, remove the return lines and tees as an assembly by lifting tees off the nozzles.

step1.para: Install protective caps from ZTSE-4135 onto the high pressure lines which were disconnected. Refer to Figure 5.34.

figure.caption: Figure 5.34 Protective Cap from ZTSE-4135 on High Pressure Fuel Lines

step1.para: Install protective cap onto nozzles using ZTSE-4135 protective cap set. Refer to Figure 5.35.

figure.caption: Figure 5.35 Installing Protective Caps on Nozzles

step1.para: Remove the nozzle from the cylinder head bore using a box wrench. Refer to Figure 5.36. TURN COUNTERCLOCKWISE TO REMOVE NOZZLES.

As nozzles are removed, place a protective cap on the nozzle tip. Place nozzle assemblies in a holding rack (ZTSE-4141). Identify each nozzle as to the cylinder from which it was removed. This permits replacing the nozzles in their respective ports during installation. Refer to Figure 5.37.

caution.para: BE EXTREMELY CAREFUL NOT TO DAMAGE NOZZLE TIPS DURING REMOVAL.

step1.para: Verify the nozzle code is marked one of the following: "BB" code [CAV Nozzles] or "C" or "D" code [STANADYNE Nozzles] Refer to Figure 5.38.

note.para: Effective with engine S/N 622179 and above, Stanadyne nozzle and holder assemblies are available as an alternate source to CAV nozzle and holder assemblies, for production. The Stanadyne "C" and "D" code nozzles have no notches on the nozzle holder body flats. The CAV nozzles have two notches at each flat. This provides quick vendor identification.

figure.caption: Figure 5.38 Nozzle Code Location Injection Nozzle Testing
